required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Screening for Colonization With Resistant Enterobacterales in Neutropenic Patients With Hematologic Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: Screening for Colonization With Resistant Enterobacterales in Neutropenic Patients With Hematologic Malignancies (SCENE)

collaborator.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University
National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, observational cohort study to assess the frequency with which neutropenic patients with hematologic malignancies and hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT) recipients are colonized with fluoroquinolone-resistant Enterobacterales (FQRE) and the clinical impact of FQRE colonization.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective, observational cohort study to assess the frequency with which neutropenic patients with hematologic malignancies and hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT) recipients are colonized with fluoroquinolone-resistant Enterobacterales (FQRE) and the clinical impact of FQRE colonization.
The investigator will collect perianal swabs from patients receiving induction chemotherapy for acute leukemia or undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HCT), and who are receiving fluoroquinolone (FQ) prophylaxis. FQRE colonization will be assessed by culture, and the investigator will correlate FQRE colonization with the risk of Gram-negative bacteremia during neutropenia.
Population: 410 adults with acute leukemia who are receiving induction chemotherapy and HCT recipients who are receiving FQ prophylaxis during neutropenia.
Results of this study will be combined with a portion of subject data from an identically-designed R01-funded study of FQRE colonization.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Until neutrophil recovery or 30 days after collection of the first swab in patients who do not have neutrophil recovery by 30 days
primary_outcome.description: Gram-negative BSI during the episode of neutropenia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 4 days after initiation of chemotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: Colonization with fluoroquinolone-resistant Enterobacterales (FQRE) and Extended-spectrum-beta-lactamase-producing Enterobacterales (ESBL-E) upon initiation of chemotherapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until neutrophil recovery or 30 days after collection of the first swab in patients who do not have neutrophil recovery by 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence (Yes/No) of fever (≥38.0°C) during the episode of neutropenia.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until neutrophil recovery or 30 days after collection of the first swab in patients who do not have neutrophil recovery by 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Any BSI during the episode of neutropenia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to neutrophil recovery or 30 days after collection of the first swab in patients who do not have neutrophil recovery by 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Intensive care unit admission prior to recovery from neutropenia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Occurs within 90 days from the initiation of chemotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: 90-day mortality from the initiation of chemotherapy

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of and risk factors for acquiring FQRE and ESBL-E during the episode of neutropenia
other_outcome.time_frame: During the episode of neutropenia, up to 30 days
other_outcome.description: Acquisition of FQRE and ESBL-E in patients not initially colonized with these organisms

arm_group.description: Receiving induction chemotherapy for acute leukemia, and receiving fluoroquinolone (FQ) prophylaxis.
Undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HCT), and receiving fluoroquinolone (FQ) prophylaxis.

biospec_descr.textblock: Perianal swabs are collected from subjects and only isolates are retained. Bloodstream infection isolates are retained.

study_pop.textblock: 410 adults with acute leukemia who are receiving induction chemotherapy and HCT recipients who are receiving FQ prophylaxis during neutropenia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Ability to provide informed consent
2. Male or female ≥18 years of age
3. Receiving intensive induction chemotherapy for acute leukemia or undergoing HCT
4. Receive fluoroquinolone prophylaxis during neutropenia
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Expected to have <7 days of neutropenia (absolute neutrophil count ≤500 cells/μL) after receipt of chemotherapy (a) (acute leukemia cohort only)
2. First swab collected ≥5 days after onset of chemotherapy
3. First swab collected after the day of transplant (HCT cohort only)
4. Acute promyelocytic leukemia
5. Receiving chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-T-cell therapy
6. Pregnant women as determined by clinician

overall_official.affiliation: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

facility.name: University of California San Fransisco Medical Center
University of North Carolina Chapel Hill
